intro: Bauhinia hirsutiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered bauhinia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, bipinnate leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy texture. The plant produces showy, butterfly-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Bauhinia hirsutiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
